<a id="TLSOptions"></a>

# TLSOptions

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

TLS configuration for clients and servers.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

TLSOptions abstracts the configuration options for the [StreamPeerTLS](StreamPeerTLS.md) and [PacketPeerDTLS](PacketPeerDTLS.md) classes.

Objects of this class cannot be instantiated directly, and one of the static methods [client()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_client), [client_unsafe()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_client_unsafe), or [server()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_server) should be used instead.




```gdscript
    # Create a TLS client configuration which uses our custom trusted CA chain.
    var client_trusted_cas = load("res://my_trusted_cas.crt")
    var client_tls_options = TLSOptions.client(client_trusted_cas)

    # Create a TLS server configuration.
    var server_certs = load("res://my_server_cas.crt")
    var server_key = load("res://my_server_key.key")
    var server_tls_options = TLSOptions.server(server_key, server_certs)
```

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="TLSOptions_method_client"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TLSOptions](TLSOptions.md) **client**\ (\ trusted_chain\: [X509Certificate](X509Certificate.md) = null, common_name_override\: [String](String.md) = ""\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#TLSOptions_method_client)

Creates a TLS client configuration which validates certificates and their common names (fully qualified domain names).

You can specify a custom `trusted_chain` of certification authorities (the default CA list will be used if ``null``), and optionally provide a `common_name_override` if you expect the certificate to have a common name other than the server FQDN.

\ **Note:** On the Web platform, TLS verification is always enforced against the CA list of the web browser. This is considered a security feature.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TLSOptions_method_client_unsafe"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TLSOptions](TLSOptions.md) **client_unsafe**\ (\ trusted_chain\: [X509Certificate](X509Certificate.md) = null\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#TLSOptions_method_client_unsafe)

Creates an **unsafe** TLS client configuration where certificate validation is optional. You can optionally provide a valid `trusted_chain`, but the common name of the certificates will never be checked. Using this configuration for purposes other than testing **is not recommended**.

\ **Note:** On the Web platform, TLS verification is always enforced against the CA list of the web browser. This is considered a security feature.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TLSOptions_method_get_common_name_override"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_common_name_override**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TLSOptions_method_get_common_name_override)

Returns the common name (domain name) override specified when creating with [client()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_client).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TLSOptions_method_get_own_certificate"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[X509Certificate](X509Certificate.md) **get_own_certificate**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TLSOptions_method_get_own_certificate)

Returns the [X509Certificate](X509Certificate.md) specified when creating with [server()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_server).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TLSOptions_method_get_private_key"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[CryptoKey](CryptoKey.md) **get_private_key**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TLSOptions_method_get_private_key)

Returns the [CryptoKey](CryptoKey.md) specified when creating with [server()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_server).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TLSOptions_method_get_trusted_ca_chain"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[X509Certificate](X509Certificate.md) **get_trusted_ca_chain**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TLSOptions_method_get_trusted_ca_chain)

Returns the CA [X509Certificate](X509Certificate.md) chain specified when creating with [client()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_client) or [client_unsafe()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_client_unsafe).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TLSOptions_method_is_server"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_server**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TLSOptions_method_is_server)

Returns ``true`` if created with [server()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_server), ``false`` otherwise.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TLSOptions_method_is_unsafe_client"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_unsafe_client**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TLSOptions_method_is_unsafe_client)

Returns ``true`` if created with [client_unsafe()](TLSOptions.md#TLSOptions_method_client_unsafe), ``false`` otherwise.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TLSOptions_method_server"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TLSOptions](TLSOptions.md) **server**\ (\ key\: [CryptoKey](CryptoKey.md), certificate\: [X509Certificate](X509Certificate.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#TLSOptions_method_server)

Creates a TLS server configuration using the provided `key` and `certificate`.

\ **Note:** The `certificate` should include the full certificate chain up to the signing CA (certificates file can be concatenated using a general purpose text editor).
